Raleigh.Raleigh Union Station:
Raleigh Union Station in Raleigh, North Carolina refers to both a passenger train station that operated 1890-1950 or a nearby passenger train station under construction that will open in 2018.


== 1890 Building ==
The original Raleigh Union Station was constructed by the Raleigh and Gaston Railroad, a predecessor of the Seaboard Air Line, at the corner of Dawson and West Martin streets. It also served the original Norfolk Southern Railway and the Southern Railway, with a total of four tracks.
